AvProblem.comment: <2400 m glide-snow avalanches on steep smooth slopes, wet-snow slides

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Fresh snow and freshly generated snowdrifts are prone to triggering
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: At high altitudes the fresh snow and freshly generated snowdrift accumulations are prone to triggering. One person an trigger small-to-medium avalanches. Older, covered snowdrift masses are easily triggered, esp. by large additional loading. Such danger zones are getting covered by fresh snow, are thus hard to recognize. Glide-snow avalanches can trigger at any time of day or night and in isolated cases reach medium size. Caution below glide cracks. In very steep terrain, slides and small loose-snow avalanches are possible.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Snowfall (20-40 cm) anticipated, locally up to 50 cm, esp. in ridgeline terrain it will be transported. Fresh and small ddrifts bond well with the old snowpack due to wind and warmth. Older snowdrift accumulations lie deposited atop soft layers, esp. on high-altitude shady slopes. The old snowpack is generally compact and stable, at lower and intermediate altitudes it is thoroughly moist and wet at ground level. At lower altitudes the snow is being deposited on bare ground.
BulletinMeasurements.wxSynopsisComment: Nocturnal hours: Gray skies, wet weather, snowfal down to low lying areas. Wednesday daytime: Gray skies, poor visibility, light-to-moderate snowfall all day long. At 2000 m: -5 degrees. Moderate to brisk easterly winds.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Thursday will be quite sunny. Danger levels will recede.

AvProblem.comment: glide-snow avalanches on steep smooth slopes, hillsides, in forest lanes
small glide-snow avalanches in very steep terrain

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Loose-snow slides and small glide-snow avalanches
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Small-to-medium glide-snow avalanches are still possible on steep grass-covered slopes, in forest clearances and on hillsides. Caution urged below glide cracks. In very steep terrain, small loose wet-snow avalanches can be expected, these can also be triggered by 1 person in steep terrain. Danger of being swept along and being forced to take a fall should be taken into consideration.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: There will be 10-15 cm of fresh snow, locally up to 30 cm, amid wind impaxt, deposited at intermediate altitudes atop a thoroughly moist and at ground level wet snowpack. The fresh snow will bond well with the old snowpack. Warm ground and the wet snowpack base reinforce the gliding movements of the entire snowpack. At low altitudes the snowfall will be deposted on bare ground.
BulletinMeasurements.wxSynopsisComment: Nocturnal hours: Gray skies, wet weather, snowfal down to low lying areas. Wednesday daytime: Gray skies, poor visibility, light-to-moderate snowfall all day long. At 2000 m: -5 degrees. Moderate to brisk easterly winds.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Thursday will be quite sunny. Â Avalanche danger levels are not expected to change significantly.
